cheezits: The easiest way for subtitles is. 1.download and install matroska pack from matroska.org 2.open the video in media player classic. Make sure the subtitle file is the same name as the video file. for further help, try videohelp.com

same goes for vobsub. ex:
Kung.Fu.Hustle.2004.RETAiL.DVDRip.XviD-TLF.avi
Kung.Fu.Hustle.2004.RETAiL.DVDRip.XviD-TLF.sub

Goddamn. I downloaded this and it looks stunningly good. Amazing quality, but I can`t make the subtitles work at all. What am I supposed to do with this Matruska pack? I also downloaded Media Subtitler but to no help.

its easy, just change thw name on the "srt" or "sub" to the same name as the file that u will be watching. Ofcurse you need Vobsub to make it work.

elniro (and anyone else with the same problem): I couldn't get the subs to work at all, either, so I downloaded new subs. Swedish works for me, so I got them from http://www.undertexter.se/. There are other sites with subs in other languages out there, too.
